meanings.definition: The act of removing mythical elements from a story or belief.
meanings.sent1: The demythologization of the ancient tale made it easier for children to understand.
meanings.sent2: Scholars engaged in the demythologization of folklore to uncover its true origins.
meanings.sent3: During the demythologization of the legend, they discovered the dragon was actually a misunderstood lizard.
meanings.sent4: Her demythologization of the ghost story revealed it was just a prank gone wrong.
meanings.sent5: The demythologization of the myth turned it into a simple moral lesson for all to learn.

meanings.definition: The process of interpreting religious texts in a non-literal way.
meanings.sent1: The demythologization of the scripture allowed for a deeper understanding of its teachings.
meanings.sent2: The demythologization of the religious text led to new insights into its symbolism.
meanings.sent3: His demythologization of the parable turned it into a humorous anecdote for the congregation.
meanings.sent4: Through demythologization, she saw the religious text as a guide rather than a rulebook.
meanings.sent5: The demythologization of the mythos made the stories more relatable to modern audiences.
